original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge up in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edge up in mid day trade on Wednesday on policy rate cuts which stimulated interest as debt restructuring fears lower, an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index (ASPI) was up 1.61 percent or 145.97 points to 9,215.61, while the most liquid index was S&P SL20 was up 2.79 percent or 71.81 points to 2,641.55
Top gainers were, Commercial Bank, LOLC Finance & Vallibel One. (Colombo/June14/2023)
